page.title: 13SELF-SUFFICIENCY NEAR HOWNAM
page.content: Living in an area about eleven miles from the nearest big town,as the 12 resident families around Hownam do, means that being self-sufficient comes high on the agenda.The area consists of narrow roads and hills,so being cut off in winter weather is quite likely accentuating the need for a good food store.All 12 families make their own cakes and biscuits,grow most of the vegetables they need, and make jam. Most houses now have a deep freeze which greatly assists in vegetable storage.9 of the families also grow fruit,and 8 make preserves.3 ladies can make their own bread, though not all the time.8 ladies knit clothes for their families and 5 make sewn ones too.4 households provide their own milk,and 7 their own eggs. One family keeps five hives of bees, which supply a lot of people with honey.
